clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Trial on the Clinical Feasibility of a New Full Thickness Endoscopic Plication Device for Patients With GERD.
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Multi Center Case Controlled Trial on the Clinical Feasibility of a New Full Thickness Endoscopic Plication Device for Patients With GERD.

brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective multi center case controlled trial on the clinical feasibility of a new full thickness endoscopic plication device for patients with GERD.
The primary objective of the present trial is to investigate, clinical feasibility of the GERDx™ device, evaluating surgical aspects, quality of life, and symptom sores. Secondary objective of the trail is to evaluate objective data before and after the procedure, using manometry and 24h impedeance measurement

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life using the Gastrointestinal Quality of Life Index
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in Quality of Life at 3 months, one year and three years after the intervation

secondary_outcome.measure: lower esophageal sphincter pressure using oesophageal manometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in lower esophageal sphincter pressure at 3 months, one year and 3 years after the intervantion

secondary_outcome.measure: DeMeester score, number of reflux events using 24h-ph-Impedancemeasurment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in DeMeester score at 3 months, one year and 3 years after the intervantion
